SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class ScoreBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.events.Observable
it.polimi.ingsw.model.ScoreBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ScoreBoard extends Observable implements Serializable
The ScoreBoard class represents a scoreboard that tracks players' score throughout the game.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ScoreBoard

      public ScoreBoard(List<Player> players)
      Construct a new ScoreBoard object for the given list of players. Initial scores are set to 0 for each player.
      Parameters:
      players - A list of Players participating in the game.

    • ScoreBoard

      public ScoreBoard()
      Construct an empty ScoreBoard object. No operation is allowed on such object beside copyScore. This constructor is used in the client's model to set up a disposable object that will be overridden as soon as an updated scoreboard is received.

  • Method Details

    • getScore

      public int getScore(String nickName)
      Retrieves the score of the specified player from the scoreboard.
      Parameters:
      nickName - the nickname of the Player whose score is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      The score of the specified player.

    • setScore

      public void setScore(String nickName, int score)
      Sets the score for the specified player in the scoreboard.
      Parameters:
      nickName - the nickname of the Player whose score needs to be set.
      score - the new score to set for the player.

    • addScore

      public void addScore(String nickName, int scoreDelta)
      Increases the score of a player in the scoreboard by a specified amount.
      Parameters:
      nickName - the nickname of the Player whose score needs to be updated
      scoreDelta - the amount to add to the Player's score.

    • copyScore

      public void copyScore(ScoreBoard scoreBoard)
      Copy the given scoreboard data in this scoreboard object
      Parameters:
      scoreBoard - ScoreBoard that needs to be overridden.

    • setWinners

      public void setWinners(List<Player> winners)
      Allows to set the winning players list to the scoreboard
      Parameters:
      winners - list of player representing the game's winners

    • getWinners

      public List<Player> getWinners()
      Retrieves the list of winning players.
      Returns:
      list of Players representing the game's winners

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
